value.title: Biden pledges appeal of 'deeply disappointing' DACA ruling
value.excerpt: He again called on Congress to pass the American Dream and Promise Act to "finally provide security to all Dreamers, who have lived too long in fear.”

value.title: Biden pledges appeal of ‘deeply disappointing’ DACA ruling
value.excerpt: Biden urged Congress to move forward with legislation to permanently protect those covered by the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program.

value.title: Biden grappling with 'pandemic of the unvaccinated'
value.excerpt: Two weeks after celebrating America’s near “independence” from the coronavirus, President Joe Biden is confronting the worrying reality of rising cases and deaths

value.title: Joe Biden taps Jane Hartley as ambassador to the UK
value.excerpt: Joe Biden has tapped Jane Hartley, a Democratic fundraiser and former ambassador to France, as the US envoy to the UK, according to people familiar with the matter. Hartley’s selection comes after weeks of uncertainty over Biden’s intentions with regard to the post.

value.title: Biden: Social media platforms 'killing people' with misinfo
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden says social media companies are “killing people” by failing to police misinformation on their platforms about the COVID-19 vaccines

value.title: Biden to reappoint Jerome Powell as Fed chair, say economists
value.excerpt: U.S. President Joe Biden will reappoint current Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell for a second four-year term starting February next year, according to an overwhelming majority of economists polled by Reuters this week.

value.title: Biden sees U.S. child tax credit as 'giant step' to counter poverty
value.excerpt: Some 35 million American families have received their first monthly payout from the U.S. government in an expanded income-support program that President Joe Biden said on Thursday could help end child poverty.

value.title: 'Ingraham Angle' on Biden calling UN probe on US, South African riots

value.title: Chaffetz claims 'direct evidence' Joe Biden was privy to Hunter's business deals, as House GOP seeks documents
value.excerpt: Government Accountability Institute fellow Jason Chaffetz claimed Wednesday on “Hannity” that there is direct evidence being laid out by one of his GAI colleagues that shows President Joe Biden was privy to Hunter Biden's foreign business dealings.

value.title: Senate Democrats' $3.5T budget deal backs up Biden's goals
value.excerpt: Senate Democrats have taken a major step toward meeting President Joe Biden's proposals for massive spending on government programs for climate change, health care, family services and more

value.title: Ingraham slams Biden's Philadelphia voter rights speech: 'As usual, liberals are at war with the facts'
value.excerpt: In response to President Joe Biden's Tuesday speech on voting rights protection in Philadelphia, Fox News host Laura Ingraham ripped the president on "The Ingraham Angle," claiming that "as usual, liberals are at war with the facts" and that Biden was "just reading whatever script his writers handed to him.

value.title: Gutfeld rips Biden as 'pathological liar' injecting race into election law speech amid Texas standoff

value.title: Biden picks ex-West Virginia health official as drug czar
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden is nominating West Virginia’s former health commissioner as the nation’s top anti-drug official, tapping a doctor who served on the front lines of the nation’s opioid epidemic

value.title: Angela Merkel doubts Joe Biden meeting will solve gas pipeline dispute
value.excerpt: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said Monday that she doubts the dispute between her country and the United States over a nearly completed gas pipeline from Russia will be fully resolved at a meeting with President Joe Biden this week.

value.title: Biden: "The United States Stands Firmly With The People Of Cuba"
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden addressed civil unrest in Cuba before delivering remarks on gun crime at a press availability on Monday. "The United States stands firmly with the people of Cuba as they assert their universal rights,

value.title: Biden releases statement on Cuba protests: 'We stand with the Cuban people'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Monday released a statement in solidarity with the people of Cuba who marched on the island Sunday to protest leadership amid the pandemic.

value.title: More competition: Biden signs order targeting big business
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order that targets what he says are anticompetitive practices in tech, health care and other parts of the economy

value.title: Joe Biden urges Vladimir Putin to ‘take action’ against ransomware hackers
value.excerpt: Joe Biden warned Vladimir Putin that Russia would face consequences if it failed to act against hackers behind a spate of ransomware attacks, saying the US would take “any necessary action” to protect its people and infrastructure.

value.title: 'Your World' on Biden withdrawing troops, Florida recovery efforts

value.title: Joe Biden departs to Chicago - Washington
value.excerpt: U.S. President Joe Biden walks on the South Lawn f the White House in Washington as he returns from a day trip to Chicago on Wednesday, July 7, 2021. Biden is to deliver remarks on his Build Back Better agenda at McHenry County College in Crystal Lake,

value.title: In Illinois, Biden to push money for families and child care
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden is turning his focus to pitching his proposed investments in families and education, using a visit to a community college in a key Illinois swing district to highlight how his spending on so-called human infrastructure would boost the economy.

value.title: Biden Says 'Democracy Did Prevail' On Six-Month Anniversary of Capitol Riots

value.title: Hillicon Valley: Biden to confront cyberattacks following Kaseya attack | JEDI contract axed | Tech giants warn Hong Kong
value.excerpt: Welcome to Hillicon Valley, The Hill's newsletter detailing all you need to know about the tech and cyber news from Capitol Hill to Silicon Valley.

value.title: Biden: Ransomware attack 'caused minimal damage'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden says the latest ransomware attack on Miami-based software company Kaseya "caused minimal damage" to U.S. businesses but information is still being gathered. Thousands of victims have been identified in at least 17 countries.
